title: Email and calendar management
content:
# Outlook App Guide

## Navigation
- **Bottom Navigation Bar**: Switch between **Mail** (inbox), **Calendar** (schedule), and **Apps** (contacts/files).
- **Side Menu**: Tap the **Home icon** (top-left) to access **Favorites**, **Folders** (Inbox, Sent, Drafts, Junk), and **Groups**.
- **Inbox Tabs**: The main view is divided into **Focused** (important emails) and **Other**; tap the tabs at the top to switch.

## Search
- **Universal Search**: Tap the **Magnifying Glass icon** (top right) to find emails, events, or contacts.
- **Category Filters**: On the search screen, use tabs to filter results specifically by **Mail**, **People**, **Files**, or **Events**.
- **Quick Contacts**: The search page displays visual circles for your top contacts (e.g., "PIC CETC", "Rahul") for one-tap access.

## Common Actions
- **Compose Email**: Tap the floating **New Message button** (blue square with a pencil) at the bottom right of the inbox.
- **Formatting & Attachments**: Inside the compose screen, use the bottom toolbar to **Attach files** (paperclip), **Insert photos** (camera), or **Format text** (A icon).
- **Filter Inbox**: Tap the **Filter** button in the top right corner of the inbox to sort views (e.g., by Unread or Flagged).
- **Manage Folders**: Open the side menu to view specific folders like **Archive**, **Deleted**, or **Conversation History**.

## Tips
- **Focused Inbox**: The app automatically sorts high-priority mail into the **"Focused"** tab to reduce clutter.
- **Calendar Access**: You can jump straight to your schedule using the **Calendar** icon in the bottom bar, avoiding the need to open a separate app.
- **Account Switching**: Use the icon in the top left sidebar (e.g., Microsoft logo) to add or switch between different email accounts.
